media.caption: Ye Rose Tree Inn courtesy of Jan Whitaker

text.headline: Ye Rose Tree Inn
text.text: From 1908 to 1923, Madame Anna deNaucaze ran Ye Rose Tree Inn at 252 Bridge Street, Northampton. Ye Rose Tree Inn was on the Smith College Warden's list of approved establishments until 1923 when students were alegedly caught smoking. During its 15 year run, Ye Rose Tree Inn provided a space for independent women to dine with special decor and extravagant meals. It is likely that this would have also been a site of gay men cruising tearooms. Madame ran the Inn with various women business partners and there is no mention of a "Monsieur" deNaucaze. She was also known for wearing "mannish suits and stiff collars".

text.headline: Girls Club Chicopee
text.text: The Chicopee Girls Club was founded in 1949 and was the oldest women's bar on the east coast. At some point during its 50 year run the Girls Club changes to Hideaway or Our Hideaway.

Toni Cade Bambara speaks at Smith College and Womonfyre
text.text: Toni Cade Bambara speaks at Smith College, reading from her short story collection, Gorilla My Love, sponsored by Afro-American Studies at Smith, Black Studies at Amherst College, and Womonfyre Books.

text.headline: La Mix forms
text.text: La Mix formed, prior to this they had worked together without a name at Rahars for six weeks. La Mix started having women's dances at Hangar One and later at Poor Richards. All Lesbian DJ's producing reguar dances.

text.text: VWM

text.text: appears to have formed a Five College Feminist-lesbian group.

text.text: First meeting of GALA (Gay and Lesbian Activists), potluck with 15 people.

text.text: Dance at Davic, music by Faye. sponsored by Smith College Lesbian Alliance, Women in Struggle, and Northampton Committee on El Salvador.

text.text: Word is Out film' sponsored by Smith College Women's Resource Center

text.text: Women's Production Company forms in Northampton. To produce Women Artist events for women.

text.text: Sponsored by Smith College Lesbian Alliance, Variations, and Valley Independent Cinema as a fundraiser for Variations

text.text: Hampshire College Women's Center helped get the space.

text.headline: Smith administration tried to close Hover House
text.text: Smith administration tried to close Hover House but were not allowed by the Trustees because they didn't give the current residents warning that they would close the house.

text.text: Exploring Sexual Preference, Discussing Motherhood, Women and Stress, and Commonalities of Women sponsored by the Every Women's Center

Valley Women's Martial Arts returns to Northampton
text.text: Get Dojo in Thornes Market.

text.headline: Womonfyre Books moves from Masonic St. to Center St.
"A Woman's Workshop: For Jewish Lesbians and Thier Friends"
text.text: Draws over 100 lesbians, Smith College.

"Dyke Dance"
text.text: at Hampshire College sponsored by NALL, a benefit to make New Alexandria Lesbian Library wheelchair accessible.

text.text: A benefit reading for "Old Lady Blue Jeans" by Elana Dykewomon for Lesbians and girl children only at Smith College

text.text: For or Held By GALA members at Smith College

text.headline: North Valley Typesetting and Graphics
text.text: Four women buy production equipment from New Roots to form a designer and artist cooperative; they were unsuccessful as such and became the business collective, North Valley Typesetting and Graphics in Greenfield VWM [included LGBTQ people, space or programs]

text.text: Produced by Hampshire Women's Center and Lesbian Alliance

text.text: Lesbian Rape alert meeting in Northampton, Thornes Market after 2 lesbians are raped in Northampton and another woman in 7 weeks. About 200 women attended

text.text: 12/18/1982 - Threatening phone calls made to two lesbians in Northampton about NALL.

text.text: over 2,000 march in Northampton

text.text: Attended by Valley Lesbian Feminists in Seneca, New York. - Jean Grossholtz (Mount Holyoke College, professor, Lesbian)

text.text: Northampton centered

text.text: Written by the Citizens Action network

text.headline: GALA and CAN
text.text: inititates coalition to fight for a broad-based Anti-Discrimination ordinance in Northampton

text.headline: More threatening calls
text.text: More threatening calls made to NALL.

text.headline: Second Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL
text.text: Lesbian community meeting about the Lesbian Foundation, held at Smith College

text.headline: Written Notes threatening NALL
text.text: 01/13/1983 - Written notes, threatening NALL and coommunity as a group, left at Womonfyre Books. "The paper is right, homosexual people must be eradicated. S.H.U.N. - Stop homosexual Unity Now" and 'NALL will never exist, Gays must be persecuted". ("the paper" refers to an editorial by Joseph Sobran published in the Daily Hampshire Gazette which was viciously antigay).

text.headline: The Daily Hampshire Gazette publishes first article ever on Womonfyre Books
text.text: headline reads "A Women's Bookstore Gains ' Legitimacy'"

text.headline: Threatening Phone Calls
text.text: 1/22 - A phone call to a lesbian by an unidentified male voice: "Whats going on in the meetings?". 1/24 - Another call : "What's going on in the meetings?" different male voice.

text.headline: Betsy Rose and Cathy Winter perform at Iron Horse
text.text: Feminist musicians. VWM

text.headline: Lesbian Community Meetings on Threats to NALL
text.text: 1/12 - 2nd Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL. 1/20 - 3rd Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL and community. 1/27 - 4th Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to community. 1/30 - Small community meeting to discuss harassment and Mayor's meeting. All meetings were held at the Valley Women's Martial Arts Dojo in Thornes Market, Northampton.

text.headline: Threatening Letter
text.text: A long letter from S.H.U.N was left at Womonfyre Books threatening the store, GALA, NALL and the Smith College Lesbian Alliance. Saying gays should be "eradicated" and threatening to burn the bookstore down

text.headline: Small community meeting to discuss harassment and upcoming meeting with the Mayor
GALA sponsors a workshop series on Racism and Anti-Semitism for Lesbians and Gay Men
Lesbian Union at University of Massachusetts Amherst grows,
text.text: Begins Thursday night rap (discussion) groups

text.text: Subgroup on the Mayors meeting formed from Jan 30th meeting

text.text: about 300 lesbians, gays and supporters

text.text: support party in Leeds for New Alexandria Lesbian Library

Gay and Lesbian Aactivists benefit dance
"Pitfalls in Paradise"
text.text: Produced by Ad Hoc Women Productions

text.headline: Murder and Arson Threats made to Northampton Lesbian Enterprises
text.text: A threat is received on a tape machine at a local business threatening to kill, first to the coordinator of NALL, then to Kiriyo Spooner, and third to burn Womonfyre Books. The message is received on Saturday and they say that the store will be burned on Tuessday. The store is under 24 hour surveilance for the next 3 days, and for the 2 Tuesdays thereafter.

text.headline: Forum on Lesbian Studies
text.text: held at Smith College by Smith College Lesbian Alliance

text.headline: More threats of violence
text.text: More threats of violence at the march on May 14, received on May 8-9 and 5-16

text.headline: Gay and Lesbian Film Weekends
text.text: Gay and Lesbian Activists has two weekends of films on gays and lesbians

text.headline: Womyn's Dance at Field House
text.text: Sponsored by Smith College Lesbian Alliance

text.headline: S.H.U.N. threat against the march
text.text: yelled on street at two lesbians in Northampton

text.headline: Kate Clinton benefit performance
text.text: Kate Clinton, a lesbian feminist humorist gives a benefit performance for TRIVIA cosponsored by the Mount Holyoke Women's Center and TRIVIA VWM

text.headline: Lesbian Humor Night at Hampshire Red Barn
"Smith is for Lovers"
text.text: day held at Smith College sponsored by Smith College Lesbian Alliance.

text.headline: Picket against pornography
text.text: Organized by an unnamed group of followers of Andrea Dwarken. Conducted at Augie's Tobacco Shop in Amherst center coming out of the previous march on rape. VWM

text.headline: 5 phone threats against the march
text.text: left on VWV's answering machine from SHUN

text.headline: phone threats against the march
text.text: left on GALA's answering machine from SHUN.

text.headline: Heramedia come to Northampton
text.text: Heramedia, Lesbian Video Project from NYC, comes to Northampton to film Lesbian & Gay Liberation March, victims of harassment (Kiriyo Spooner, Bet Birdfish, Kim Christiansen) on location in Leeds at New Alexandria Lesbian Library & at Womonfyre Books for project on Lesbians & violence

text.headline: Womonfyre Books is Egged
text.text: The bookstore gets egged on May 28th, May 29th, July 8th, October, December 27th, January 29th, 1984 and April 23, 1984

text.headline: S.H.U.N. call to Valley Women's Voice
text.text: Threatens all lesbian and gay groups with violence.

text.headline: Daily Hampshire Gazette runs its 4-part series on lesbians
text.text: Positive response to Lesbian and Gay community criticism of Gazette Coverage by making an effort to educate the general public.

text.headline: Jil Krolik of Womonfyre Books sets up a phone trap in cooperation with the District Attorney and State Police.
text.text: Jil Krolik of Womonfyre Books sets up a trap for the phone harasser by heavily advertising a reading by Becky Births scheduled for August 5 at the store. The ads list Jills home phone as the information number. The District Attorney's office provides a telephone answering machine, and Jil stays at home to note the time of phone calls. Approximately 35 phone calls from a group of local kids are received. Three phone calls from S.H.U.N. are also received on July 30. A Northampton male is arrested August 5 for those calls.

text.headline: Smith College administration attempts to deal with the "Lesbian problem"
text.text: Smith College administration attempts to gain control over contents of Smith College Lesbian Alliance's workshops because of pressure from Alumni and Trustees to deal with the "Lesbian Problem".

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves to Florence
FBI Grand Jury Community Education Coalition started again
text.text: In reaction to the FBI using the harassment as an excuse to do a fishing expedition in the Lesbian and Gay community.

text.headline: Thirteenth Moon
text.text: A witch supply store opens at 56 Main St. in Northampton

text.headline: Medusa Defense Fund
text.text: To defray legal costs for a former Green St. resident accused of murdering her woman lover.

text.headline: "Lesbians and Health"
text.text: a workshop sponsored by Smith College Lesbian Alliance at Smith College

text.headline: A Northampton male is convicted of violating the civil rights of three Lesbians.
text.text: A Northampton male is convicted of violating the civil rights of 3 lesbians and is sentenced to one year in jail (with all but 3 months suspended.) This is the first jail sentence under the state civil rights law for a violation of a gay person's civil rights.

text.headline: Lesbian Coming Out Support Group
text.text: For women involved in any stage of the process of taking on a lesbian identity, Everywoman's Center, UMass.

text.headline: Support group for Battered Lesbians
text.text: Begins at Everywoman's Center, UMass

text.headline: Hangar One closes
text.text: Popular site for La Mix produced Lesbian dances.

text.headline: Lesbian Health Workshop
text.text: Everywoman's Center, UMass.

text.headline: "Look me in the eye: Old Women, Aging and Ageism"
text.text: A lecture by Barbara Mcdonald, benefit for TRIVIA cosponsored by Smith College Women's Resource Center. Valley Women's Movement

text.headline: La Mix started having dances
text.text: at Justin Ryan's, has three dances

text.headline: Lesbian Union Fights to Retain Space
text.text: Lesbian Union loses their original space and is offered a small storage space instead. Lesbian Union wages a successful fight for space resulting in an office in the Student Union Building, University of Massachusetts Amherst

text.headline: Lesbian and Gay Switchboard opens
text.text: GLISS opens a phone number that can be called by anyone for help (Gay/Lesbian Informational Support Services of Springfield)

text.headline: Valley Women's Martial Arts moves
text.text: From Northampton to Easthampton

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library operating in Florence
GALA begins weekly meetings to discuss march and rally in May
Permit for Lesbian and Gay Liberation March denied
text.text: Permit for 3rd Annual Lesbian and Gay Liberation March in Northampton denied for a Saturday March (May 12) by city hall. [VWV April 84]

text.headline: La Mix dances start at Poor Richard's in Amherst
text.text: La Mix - Lesbian DJ coop

text.text: Lesbian Sado Masochism Group

text.headline: Starhawk Leads a Presentation
text.text: Smith College VWM

text.headline: 30 Lesbians Stage Sit-in at Smith College President Conway's Office
text.text: 30 Lesbians stage sit-in and protest march at Smith College after Smith announces the closing of Hover House, a lesbian dorm. Sit-in was in President Conway's office, march outside.

text.headline: "Revolt of the Symbols: Philosophy in a Feminist Key"
text.text: a lecture by Emily Erwin Culpepper, a benefit for TRIVIA, cosponsored by Smith College Women's Resource Center. VWM

text.headline: Kaymarion begins Spring Studio in Attic at NALL and Herstory Exhibit
Lesbian and Gay Awareness Week at University of Massachusetts Amherst
text.text: 1984- Barbara Gitlings speaks as keynote, Joan E. Biren shows lesbian slide show, many local lesbians do workshops. Becomes LGB Awareness Week in 1987

text.headline: Ferron and Kate Clinton perform
text.text: Lesbian musician (Ferron) and comedian(Clinton). Sponsored by Crescendo Productions and Smith College Women's Resource Center.

text.headline: 4th Incest Survivors Therapy Group for Lesbians only.
Kaymarion holds series of "storytelling" meetings for Lesbians
text.text: Kaymarion holds series of "storytelling" meetings for Lesbians at NALL as she gathers more pieces of Lesbian Herstory in the Vally and updates her Herstory slideshow.

text.headline: 13th Moon moves to private residence
text.text: After incidents of violence and robbery in the store at 56 Main, 13th Moon moves to private residence.

text.headline: NALL house is wheelchair accessible
text.text: Lesbians finish building wheelchair ramp at NALL House, made possible from community fundraising

text.headline: 1st Lesbian memorial gathering
text.text: Willow dies age 32. Willow was a printer at Mother Jone's Press on Hawley Street. The invention of a community riual around death including sitting Shiva at her lesbian partners home.

text.headline: Heramedia, Lesbian Video Project, films more in Northampton
text.text: Heramedia, Lesbian Video Project from NYC, does follow-up filming & interviewing on harassment. Videotape to be distributed nationally to Lesbian groups & for caple TV. Bet Birdfish, Kiriyo Spooner, and Kim Christiansen are filmed at NALL in Northampton Library House. They show tape segments of other Lesbian victims of violence, to be included in the project: Deb Edel & Joan Nestle of LEsbian Herstory Archives (NYC), Barbara Smith and Cherrie Moraga (INC), and "Foxy Lady" on police violence in the bars (NYC).

text.headline: GALA Dance at Amherst College
text.text: A benefit for The Center for Popular Economics.

text.headline: Gay and Lesbian Liberation March
text.text: After succesfully challenging town government to get a permit. "We who believe in Freedom cannot rest until it comes"- official march slogan

text.headline: "Living in the Valley Lesbian Community: 1968-84"
text.text: Kaymarion shows updated slideshow, "Living in the Valley Lesbian Community: 1968-84" at NALL

text.headline: International Archiving Conference Includes Lesbian Content
text.text: International Archiving Conference at Smith College includes sessions on Third World Archives and also "Documenting Lesbian Herstory" session by NYC's Lesbian Herstory Archives.

text.headline: 5th Berkshire Conference on the History of Women, at Smith College. Includes Local Lesbian Content
text.text: 5th Berkshire Conference on the History of Women, at Smith College, includes moe than 15 Lesbian panels and a 24-hour Lesbian caucus room on campus. NALL shows new slideshow, "The New Alexandria Lesbian Library: The First Ten Years." Kaymarion shows updated slideshow, "Living in the Valley Lesbian community: 1968-84. Lesbian poets read, Debbie Fier performs her music, etc. [VWV May 84]

text.headline: Theater Too
text.text: Theater Too asks for area women interested in theater. 1988 Theater Too at Northampton Center for the Arts

text.headline: Sonia Johnson speaks at University of Massachusetts Amherst
text.text: VWM

text.headline: Lesbians Considering Children forum at Smith
text.text: [VWV Dec 84] 200 attend

text.headline: Crescendo Productions
text.text: Vivienne Mann and Jenny Hein announce the dissolution of "Crescendo Productions," a women friendly valley based production company.

text.headline: Mass Department of Socail Services nixes gay fostering
Lesbian Community Emergency Fund reestablished
text.text: Janet Feldman and Lore Wintergreen reestablish Community Emergency Fund, a fund for local residents in need.

text.text: Mount Holyoke College VWM

text.text: Organized by volunteers taking over for GALA

text.headline: Justina + Joyce
text.text: Lesbian Singers begin performing in the area.

text.headline: Program for Gay Lesbian and Bisexual Concerns Established by UMass
text.text: University of Massachusetts Amherst addresses LGB concerns on campus by establishing a program with staff and funding. Their first actions include a Lesbian and Gay Awareness Week in April 1986. LGB Awareness week took place again in 1987 and 1988. The initial response created The Program for Gay, Lesbian and Bisexual Concerns which is now known as The Stonewall Center : A Lesbian, Bisexual, Gay, Queer, Asexual, Intersex and Transgender Edugational Resource Center.

text.headline: The North Star Restaurant and Bar Opens
text.text: Lesbian Owned on West Street in Northampton for 8 years. The North Star is sold in November '95 and becomes The Grotto in May '96.

text.headline: HAVEN offers training
text.text: HAVEN offers two day training for LGB community members who want to stop hate crimes.

text.headline: Conflict at Student Union
text.text: During a rally at the Student Union, student Paul Cameron speaks against Gay people, and a fistfight ensues

text.text: at Simmons College

text.headline: Women's Softball League 10th anniversary + awards ceremony
Lesbian Union is reopened at University of Massachusetts Amherst
text.text: The Lesbian Union is reopened at University of Massachusetts Amherst by student Joyce Barry.

text.headline: The Lesbian Calendar
text.text: Originally The Calendar changed to The Lesbian Calendar in 1994. 1989 The Calendar refuses SHELIX ads.

text.headline: Meeting to discuss a lesbian center
Women Elders' Empowerment Network
text.text: The Women Elders' Empowerment Network petitions Northampton to address violence and discrimination against elders in the community Valley Women's Movement

text.text: First request by Bisexual people to be included in the march's name. Lesbian and Gay Liberation March in Northampton, attendance : 1500-2000. [Valley Women's Voice May 88] Pride

text.headline: Sober Dykes started?
text.text: Became Gay + Lesbian AA group at Episcopalian Church?

text.headline: A rash of vandalism strikes the area
text.text: A rash of vandalism strikes the area that may have been caused by radical feminists. Anti-men, anti-religion graffiti is found in several area churches. Many feminists write the Valley Women's Voice to express their disapproval. [Valley Women's Voice May 88]

text.headline: Lesbian Home Show
text.text: 10 year anniversary Northampton Center for the Arts - 2 days , '91- Dinner '92 - @Unitarian Church, '94 + dance @ Northampton Center for the Arts, Lesbian Bazaar '97-'98

text.text: Women express support for burning of pornographic material that took place in the Amherst Newsroom. [Valley Women's Voice March 89] VWM?

text.text: Judy Obrian's annual all day Thanksgiving special with women's music on WMUA. University of Massachusetts Amherst. 1993 - Dykes on the Air "New Start Time"

text.headline: Northampton had two lesbian feminist bookstores for a brief period of time
text.text: A brief period in fall 1988 when Lunaria opened before Womonfyre closed and Northampton had two lesbian feminist bookstores. [Valley Women's Voice April 89]

text.text: Marci Turner talks with University of Massachusetts Amherst graduate Lori Page, who recently published a lesbian bestseller, Passion's Legacy. [Valley Women's Voice Oct 91]

text.headline: East Coast Female To Male Group
text.text: Ben Powers founded the first Female to Male only support group in the Eastern United States. The East Coast Female to Male Group is the second oldest continuing transmasculine organization in the world.
